courseSectionInformation: Prerequisite: SOCW 400 or by consent of instructor for non Social Work majors.
description: Focus on the design, administration and management of social programs from a social work perspective. Content includes: principles and process of administration and management, history of social welfare administration and how this relates to the design of current programs, review of administration Organizational and leadership theories, policy formulation, agency structure, staff organization, budgeting and evaluation of management practice. Prerequisite: SOCW 400 or by consent of instructor for non Social Work majors.
label: Managing Human Service Orgs
sectionRegistrationNotes: Restricted to Graduate - Urbana-Champaign. Restricted to MSW:Social Work -UIUC.
